title: [K-12] Educational Persuasion Techniques Design for Strengthening Scientific Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of science curricula and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: A process applying persuasive techniques in offline science classes using digital devices to induce changes in learners' attitudes and behaviors

learning_goals: Can apply persuasive technology design principles (credibility, timing, etc.) to scientific problem-solving scenarios

Learners can collaborate with 3–4 peers to structure a 5-minute presentation on science experiment claims (e.g., plant growth) using three persuasive strategies (statistical data, comparative analysis, visuals) and achieve ≥12/15 on a peer rubric (clarity, logic, creativity).
Persuasively visualize and explain scientific experiment results using digital tools
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
